verses.plain: There shall no evil happen unto him that feareth the Lord; but in temptation even again he will deliver him.

tokens.t: There shall no evil happen unto him that feareth the Lord; but in temptation even again he will deliver him.

verses.plain: A wise man hateth not the law; but he that is an hypocrite therein is as a ship in a storm.

tokens.t: A wise man hateth not the law; but he that is an hypocrite therein is as a ship in a storm.

verses.plain: A man of understanding trusteth in the law; and the law is faithful unto him, as an oracle.

tokens.t: A man of understanding trusteth in the law; and the law is faithful unto him, as an oracle.

verses.plain: Prepare what to say, and so thou shalt be heard: and bind up instruction, and then make answer.

tokens.t: Prepare what to say, and so thou shalt be heard: and bind up instruction, and then make answer.

verses.plain: The heart of the foolish is like a cartwheel; and his thoughts are like a rolling axletree.

tokens.t: The heart of the foolish is like a cartwheel; and his thoughts are like a rolling axletree.

verses.plain: A stallion horse is as a mocking friend, he neigheth under every one that sitteth upon him.

tokens.t: A stallion horse is as a mocking friend, he neigheth under every one that sitteth upon him.

verses.plain: Why doth one day excel another, when as all the light of every day in the year is of the sun?

tokens.t: Why doth one day excel another, when as all the light of every day in the year is of the sun?

verses.plain: By the knowledge of the Lord they were distinguished: and he altered seasons and feasts.

tokens.t: By the knowledge of the Lord they were distinguished: and he altered seasons and feasts.

verses.plain: Some of them hath he made high days, and hallowed them, and some of them hath he made ordinary days.

tokens.t: Some of them hath he made high days, and hallowed them, and some of them hath he made ordinary days.

verses.plain: And all men are from the ground, and Adam was created of earth:

tokens.t: And all men are from the ground, and Adam was created of earth:

verses.plain: In much knowledge the Lord hath divided them, and made their ways diverse.

tokens.t: In much knowledge the Lord hath divided them, and made their ways diverse.

verses.plain: Some of them hath he blessed and exalted and some of them he sanctified, and set near himself: but some of them hath he cursed and brought low, and turned out of their places.

tokens.t: Some of them hath he blessed and exalted and some of them he sanctified, and set near himself: but some of them hath he cursed and brought low, and turned out of their places.

verses.plain: As the clay is in the potter’s hand, to fashion it at his pleasure: so man is in the hand of him that made him, to render to them as liketh him best.

tokens.t: As the clay is in the potter’s hand, to fashion it at his pleasure: so man is in the hand of him that made him, to render to them as liketh him best.

verses.plain: Good is set against evil, and life against death: so is the godly against the sinner, and the sinner against the godly.

tokens.t: Good is set against evil, and life against death: so is the godly against the sinner, and the sinner against the godly.

verses.plain: So look upon all the works of the most High; and there are two and two, one against another.

tokens.t: So look upon all the works of the most High; and there are two and two, one against another.

verses.plain: I awaked up last of all, as one that gathereth after the grapegatherers: by the blessing of the Lord I profited, and tred my winepress like a gatherer of grapes.

tokens.t: I awaked up last of all, as one that gathereth after the grapegatherers: by the blessing of the Lord I profited, and tred my winepress like a gatherer of grapes.

verses.plain: Consider that I laboured not for myself only, but for all them that seek learning.

tokens.t: Consider that I laboured not for myself only, but for all them that seek learning.

verses.plain: Hear me, O ye great men of the people, and hearken with your ears, ye rulers of the congregation.

tokens.t: Hear me, O ye great men of the people, and hearken with your ears, ye rulers of the congregation.

verses.plain: Give not thy son and wife, thy brother and friend, power over thee while thou livest, and give not thy goods to another: lest it repent thee, and thou intreat for the same again.

tokens.t: Give not thy son and wife, thy brother and friend, power over thee while thou livest, and give not thy goods to another: lest it repent thee, and thou intreat for the same again.

verses.plain: As long as thou livest and hast breath in thee, give not thyself over to any.

tokens.t: As long as thou livest and hast breath in thee, give not thyself over to any.

verses.plain: For better it is that thy children should seek to thee, than that thou shouldest stand to their courtesy.

tokens.t: For better it is that thy children should seek to thee, than that thou shouldest stand to their courtesy.

verses.plain: In all thy works keep to thyself the preeminence; leave not a stain in thine honour.

tokens.t: In all thy works keep to thyself the preeminence; leave not a stain in thine honour.

verses.plain: At the time when thou shalt end thy days, and finish thy life, distribute thine inheritance.

tokens.t: At the time when thou shalt end thy days, and finish thy life, distribute thine inheritance.

verses.plain: Fodder, a wand, and burdens, are for the ass; and bread, correction, and work, for a servant.

tokens.t: Fodder, a wand, and burdens, are for the ass; and bread, correction, and work, for a servant.

verses.plain: If thou set thy servant to labour, thou shalt find rest: but if thou let him go idle, he shall seek liberty.

tokens.t: If thou set thy servant to labour, thou shalt find rest: but if thou let him go idle, he shall seek liberty.

verses.plain: A yoke and a collar do bow the neck: so are tortures and torments for an evil servant.

tokens.t: A yoke and a collar do bow the neck: so are tortures and torments for an evil servant.

verses.plain: Send him to labour, that he be not idle; for idleness teacheth much evil.

tokens.t: Send him to labour, that he be not idle; for idleness teacheth much evil.

verses.plain: Set him to work, as is fit for him: if he be not obedient, put on more heavy fetters.

tokens.t: Set him to work, as is fit for him: if he be not obedient, put on more heavy fetters.

verses.plain: But be not excessive toward any; and without discretion do nothing.

tokens.t: But be not excessive toward any; and without discretion do nothing.

verses.plain: If thou have a servant, let him be unto thee as thyself, because thou hast bought him with a price.

tokens.t: If thou have a servant, let him be unto thee as thyself, because thou hast bought him with a price.

verses.plain: If thou have a servant, entreat him as a brother: for thou hast need of him, as of thine own soul: if thou entreat him evil, and he run from thee, which way wilt thou go to seek him?

tokens.t: If thou have a servant, entreat him as a brother: for thou hast need of him, as of thine own soul: if thou entreat him evil, and he run from thee, which way wilt thou go to seek him?
